intro: Spigelia platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. Spigelia platyphylla is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to partial shade. Its unique floral structure supports pollination by specific insects, making it an important part of local ecosystems.
